info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 17 at 10:06AM CDT until August 22 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Twin Cities/Chanhassen MN
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in the Twin Cities has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Minnesota...
Cottonwood River Above Springfield affecting Brown County.
Cottonwood River at New Ulm affecting Brown County.
Redwood River near Redwood Falls affecting Redwood County.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record.
* WHERE...Cottonwood River above Springfield.
* WHEN...From this evening to Friday evening.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 930 AM CDT Sunday, the stage was 16.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 31.0 feet Tuesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 31.4 feet on 06/18/1993.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO FRIDAY EVENING
